Tokyo Electron 2Q China Revenue Y254.1B Vs Y212.1B in 1Q
Impala Platinum Backs FY26 Guidance on Volumes, Cost and Cap Expenditure
German Retail Sales Rise as Expected
data.description:
Germany’s retail sales rose 0.2% month-over-month in September 2025, matching market estimates and swinging from a revised 0.5% decline in the previous month.

This marked the first monthly increase since June, supported by a 0.3% rise in food sales and a 0.4% gain in online and mail-order businesses.

In contrast, non-food sales fell 0.6%.

On an annual basis, retail trade also grew 0.2%, easing sharply from a downwardly revised 1.4% rise in August and marking the slowest pace in 14 months.

data.title: REG - Barclays PLC - Transaction in Own Shares
data.description:
RNS Number : 5857F Barclays PLC 31 October 2025  

31 October 2025

Barclays PLC

Transaction in own shares

Barclays PLC (the "Company") announces that it has purchased for cancellation the following number of its ordinary shares of 25 pence each on the London Stock Exchange from Citigroup Global Markets Limited as part of its buy-back announced on 30 July 2025:

Date of purchase:

30 October 2025

Number of ordinary shares purchased:

2,716,369

Highest price paid per share:

407.3000p

Lowest price paid per share:

401.2500p

Volume weighted average price paid per share:

404.9523p

The Company intends to cancel all of the purchased ordinary shares.

Following the cancellation of the repurchased shares, the Company's issued share capital will consist of 13,926,591,777 ordinary shares with voting rights.

There are no ordinary shares held in Treasury.

The above figure (13,926,591,777) may be used by shareholders (and others with notification obligations) as the denominator for the calculation by which they will determine if they are required to notify their interest in, or a change to their interest in, the Company under the FCA's Disclosure Guidance and Transparency Rules.

In accordance with Article 5(1)(b) of the Market Abuse Regulation (EU) No 596/2014, as it forms part of domestic law by virtue of the European Union (Withdrawal) Act 2018, as amended, a full breakdown of the individual purchases of ordinary shares made by Citigroup Global Markets Limited on behalf of the Company can be found at:

http://www.rns-pdf.londonstockexchange.com/rns/5857F_1-2025-10-30.pdf

Since the commencement of the share buy-back programme announced on 30 July 2025, the Company has purchased 205,529,348 ordinary shares on the London Stock Exchange in aggregate at a volume weighted average price of 374.4285p per ordinary share.

- ENDS -

For further information, please contact:

Investor Relations                                                           Media Relations

Marina Shchukina +44 (0) 20 7116 2526                   Tom Hoskin +44 (0) 20 7116 4755

This information is provided by RNS, the news service of the London Stock Exchange. RNS is approved by the Financial Conduct Authority to act as a Primary Information Provider in the United Kingdom. data.title: Danske Bank Expects Earnings to Land at Upper End of Guidance Range
data.description:
(06:30 GMT) *Danske Bank 3Q Net Interest Income DKKB9.07B
(06:30 GMT) *Danske Bank: Co-Compiled Consensus Saw 3Q Net Interest Income At DKK8.98B
(06:32 GMT) *Danske Bank 3Q Net Pft DKK5.52B
(06:32 GMT) *Danske Bank: Co-Compiled Consensus Saw 3Q Net Profit At DKK5.42B
(06:32 GMT) *Danske Bank 3Q Common Equity Tier 1 Ratio 18.7% Vs 19.1%
(06:33 GMT) *Danske Bank Still Expects Slightly Lower Total Income This Year Vs 2024
(06:33 GMT) *Danske Bank Still Expects Operating Expenses Up to DKK26B This Year
(06:34 GMT) *Danske Bank Now Expects Net Profit at Upper End of DKK21B-DKK23B Range This Year
(06:34 GMT) *Danske Bank Now Expects Loan Impairment Charges Up to DKK600M, Had Seen Up to DKK1B This Year
(07:15 GMT) Danske Bank Expects Earnings to Land at Upper End of Guidance Range

By Dominic Chopping

Danske Bank expects to report full-year earnings at the top end of its guidance range as net interest income so far this year has been resilient, while fee income has remained strong and impairments low.

The Copenhagen-based bank on Friday posted a third-quarter net profit of 5.52 billion Danish kroner ($855 million), down from 6.17 billion kroner a year earlier, while net interest income fell 1% to 9.07 billion kroner. A company-compiled consensus had expected net profit at 5.42 billion kroner with net interest income of 8.98 billion kroner.

"Our focus on and investments in customer advisory services and digital solutions continue to support the progress of our Forward '28 strategy, keeping us firmly on course to meet our full-year guidance," Chief Executive Carsten Egeriis said.

Danske Bank now expects full-year net profit to land at the upper end of its 21 billion and 23 billion kroner guidance range, while loan-impairment charges will be up to 600 million kroner, from previous guidance of up to 1 billion kroner.

Total income is still expected to be slightly lower than in 2024 and operating costs are still expected at up to 26 billion kroner.

The common equity Tier 1 ratio--a key measure of financial strength--fell to 18.7% from 19.1% a year earlier.

Write to Dominic Chopping at dominic.chopping@wsj.com

data.title: Bloom Energy Corporation Prices Upsized $2.2 Billion Convertible Senior Notes Offering
poLight ASA Confirms Design-win for TLens® in SnkeXR Medical AR Glasses
data.description:
Tønsberg, Norway 31 October 2025 – poLight ASA (OSE:PLT) today announced that its TLens® tunable lens technology is used in the SnkeXR augmented reality (AR) headset purpose-built for medical applications. The device will be unveiled on 4 November at the 2025 Medical Extended Reality Summit.

“We congratulate Snke on the launch of their SnkeXR device,” said Dr. Øyvind Isaksen, CEO of poLight ASA. “This is yet another validation of poLight’s technology lead in the optics for the AR|MR market, and demonstrates our ongoing commitment to enabling innovative and groundbreaking applications in medical markets.”

Nissan Elimelech, General Manager of Snke XR said “working with poLight TLens® technology has enabled Snke XR to deliver the best possible camera performance and accelerate the adoption and integration of AR technologies into medical devices and workflows. This powerful hardware foundation ensures reliable performance in demanding clinical environments and enables the creation of sophisticated medical applications.”

data.title: Remedy Entertainment Plc: Remedy commences an acquisition of the company’s own shares
data.description:
Remedy Entertainment Plc      Stock exchange release      October 31, 2025, at 9:15 a.m. EET

The Board of Directors of Remedy Entertainment Plc has decided to commence an acquisition of the company’s own shares, based on the authorization granted be the Annual General Meeting held on April 10, 2025. The maximum number of shares to be repurchased by Remedy Entertainment Plc is 50,000 shares, corresponding to maximum 0.37% of the total number of shares.

The purpose of the repurchases is to acquire shares to optimize Remedy’s capital structure, to otherwise be reassigned, to be held by the company, or to be cancelled. The repurchases shall commence on November 3, 2025, at the earliest, and end by December 15, 2025, at the latest. Remedy has appointed a third-party broker as the manager for the repurchases. The broker will make trading decisions independently, without influence from Remedy.

The Annual General Meeting granted on April 10, 2025, the Board of Directors an authorisation to resolve on the repurchase of a total maximum of 700,000 treasury shares by using the company’s non-restricted equity. Treasury shares are repurchased otherwise than in proportion to the existing shareholdings of the company’s shareholders in public trading at the market price quoted at the time of purchase. Treasury shares are repurchased and paid pursuant to the rules of Euroclear Finland Oy and conducted in accordance with the Market Abuse Regulation (MAR regulation, (EU) N:o 596/2014).

Remedy Entertainment Plc has a total of 13 640 451 shares and votes. Remedy Entertainment Plc does not currently hold any of its own shares.

REMEDY ENTERTAINMENT PLC

More information

Aapo Kilpinen, Investor Relations & Business Development ManagerPhone: +358 44 522 0595Email:

aapo.kilpinen@remedygames.com

Remedy in brief

Remedy Entertainment Plc is a pioneering, globally renowned video game company founded in 1995 and headquartered in Finland with an office in Stockholm, Sweden. Known for its story-driven and visually stunning action games, Remedy has created multiple successful, critically acclaimed franchises such as Control, Alan Wake and Max Payne. Remedy also develops its own Northlight game engine and tools technology that powers many of its games. Remedy’s shares are listed on Nasdaq Helsinki’s main list.

www.remedygames.com

 

Remedy commences an acquisition of the company’s own shares
